text: here outside the Supreme Court there's
been excitement and anticipation since
morning large number of people from the
LGBT community activists and lawyers
have been gathering here and there is a
huge presence of media everyone waiting
for the final judgement and when it came
there were loud cheers the court has now
clearly said any adult can engage in a
sexual activity in private and if it is
with consent it doesn't matter what the
adults gender or sexual preference is
it's taken 24 years to come to this day
and the first challenge to this
colonial-era law called section 377
actually happened in 1994 initially all
these challenges were led by NGOs that
is groups of people and not individuals
because the LGBT community was largely
closed netted but in the past few years
even students eminent personalities have
come out claim their sexual orientation
and join these challenges and gone to
the Supreme Court and now they've got
the final verdict two consenting adults
have sex of any type in private that
there is concerned and it is in private
it will not be an offense under 377 so
377 has been held to be to that extent
unconstitutional section three seven
seven prescribed a ten year jail term
for violations but activists say it was
in fact used to harass them and push
them into the closet a reality they hope
will change now
